ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: 1. I have many interests that bring me pleasure.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 2. I make the most of opportunities that are available to me.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 3. My behaviors often have negative consequences.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 4. I make friends easily.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 5. There are many activities that I find satisfying.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 6. I consider myself to be a person with many skills.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 7. Things happen that make me feel helpless or inadequate.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 8. I feel a strong sense of achievement.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 9. Changes have happened in my life that have made it hard to find enjoyment.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 10. It is easy to find good ways to spend my time.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 11. I have the abilities to obtain pleasure in my life.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 12. I have few financial resources, which limits what I can do.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 13. I have had many unpleasant experiences.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 14. It seems like bad things always happen to me.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 15. I have good social skills.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 16. I often get hurt by others.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 17. People have been mean or aggressive toward me.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 18. I have been very capable in jobs I have had.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 19. I wish I could find a place to live that brought more satisfaction to my life.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: 20. I have many opportunities to socialize with people.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Factor I. Reward Probability
Factor II. Environmental Suppressors
RPI total score
Training or randomized case
Notes: 1 = Randomized; 2 = Training; 3= Randomized-control; 4= Randomized-intervention; 5= Concurrent cohort-intervention; -1= Not applicable
